intro: Codonanthe ulei, commonly known as the golden flame orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling flames. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb moisture from the forest floor. The botanical features of Codonanthe ulei make it a popular choice for both horticultural and conservation efforts.
